description:
Pizza is cheap and real good, Panini's are AMAZING, and most of the staff is great. 5 years and the older dudes treated me like royalty. Some of the new guys suck but the food and price mostly makes up for it.

Go in, have a bite, go back.
author: Sean B.

description:
They just stole $15.17 from me. It was surreal. I ordered from their website, which uses a service called SimpleMenu. The order went through and I received an email confirmation. I went to the store to pick up my order, and they told that they did not have my order. The guy behind the counter asked for my order number. I gave him the order number, I showed him my email confirmation, and I even showed him that I was charged in my bank account in the bank app on my phone. He acted as though I was engaging in an elaborate plot to steal chicken wings from them. I asked him for the phone number of the service they use for their online orders or even a number for an owner or manager. He managed to give me the name of an alleged manage. 
 
There were a number of customers around to witness my embarrassment when trying to explain to this genius behind the counter that I was charged even though they do not have my order. He looked at me with disdain multiple times and said that this has never happened. I half expected him to call the police on me for *them* stealing *my* money. 
 
Order at your own risk. It might just be that they did not like my demographics and thus treated me like a criminal. If this happens to you, they might actually treat you differently. But what annoyed the most is that the guy behind the counter was extremely unhelpful in giving me *any* information on how I could resolve the problem. They earned this one star--I only wish I could give them a (well-deserved) negative rating after this experience.
author: Will V.

description: Best Pizza we've ever ate! I had the vegetarien one and my husband had one whit meat. We live near italy so we eat a lot of pizza. Often i do it myself, also the dough, but this dough was excellent great! Thanks vor this! We come back. Woow i don't no why they have only 3 stars. It goes also quick.
author: Nadja C.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!

This was my first time eating there and the only thing good there was the pizza. I and my friends ordered pizza to go but the establishment wasn't crowded at all so we decided to eat there. After 10 min an aggressive worker there who took our orders earlier basically KICKED US OUT!!! because he said he thought our orders were for to go but reading between the lines of his rudeness and aggressiveness it was because we were 3 YOUNG BLACK WOMEN in the restaurant. I am extremely disappointed in this place. As we were eating the pizza we were making future plans to order pizza for a little girls night at our apartment. HOWEVER,  after this experience we are NEVER COMING BACK AGAIN. Oh and by the way this review is the first step we are taking with unnecessary and unfair costumer service!
author: Sheleia B.

description: Great Pizza... came quick. Highly recommended! We ordered the Special pizza. Would order again!
author: William T.

description: Best pizza in my college days. Still amazing! Crunchy crust and soft chewy bread. Get their combo pizza  and italian panini...you won't regret it!
author: Sui N.

description:
For $3-5 per slice, it can be quite pricey. However, this was one delicious slice of pizza! My friend and I needed something quick to eat on the way to another friend's place and found this spot on the way. There were a couple people ahead of us, but the line went through quickly. I got the Pesto Pizza ($3.50), which was pretty damn good for a meatless pizza. I loved that they toasted it up for you, so it was all nice and melted to consume.

This definitely hit the spot for me that night. Good classic pizza with great topping options!
author: Cindy Z.

description: There's a Papa John's across the street but i'd rather eat here  tried to order through yelp eat but did not work. I called to make an order to pick up, answered right away. We ordered a medium san francisco special. Only 10mins till its hot and ready  not bad!
author: Beatrice T.

description:
THIS PIZZA IS FIRE!!!

Perhaps poor reviews because of service issues, but if we're talking just pizza would give five out of five. It's go to for by-the-slice I dream about this pizza.
author: Sarah V.

description: I've been coming here for a little bit, but this most recent time will probably be my last. It was a bit crowded and I ordered a slice of pesto. There was no pesto slice on the rack, so I figured I'd have to wait a bit for a fresh one, like I've done before. They decided to rush I suppose due to the crowd, and just grab an old cheese slice and cover it with some new cheese and pesto. It was hardly heated up enough and the cheese wasn't even melted on top, creating this gross consistency between the new barely melted and old stale cheese. I would've gladly waited for a new slice; but at that price, this quality of pizza is just not worth it
author: Brian W.

description: A full size pizza is $11 which comes out cheaper than ordering per slice, something to think about if you're in a group.  The pizza is delicious and their buffalo wings are tasty. Solid place to eat if you're in the area. One little snag that cost them a star from me is their strange customer service.  They are not the friendliest and when my husband had a question, he was answered in an abrupt manner...."Is this my pizza?" "No, not yours".  LOL!!  It might be a culture thing that's lost in translation, but it's all about perspective and their responses were not received well by us....paying customers. Still recommend them though.
author: Maria E.

description: We ordered from Uber Eats to have delivered while puppy sitting for my son who lives just outside the Castro. Delivery was great and on time the food however was not. The 2 small San Francisco Special Pizzas were not good at all. The Pepperoni & Canadian bacon were paper thin and sparse not even sure it was there, the outside edges of the pizza was missing any toppings what so ever.  We ordered Ceaser Salads with each pizza they were fresh with lots of cheese and croutons thank goodness there was something edible in the order. We spent $70 with tip on this order and ended up tossing the 2 pizzas out. I placed a complaint with Uber Eats and sent them a photo in their app, but forgot to take a photo for myself to have, regret that now. I would like some sort of compensation back from Uber Eats as I would never order from this establishment again it was horrible.
author: Crystal M.

description: I have ordered a Pizza from them through BeyondMenu, 1hr after (20mins past the delivery window) I receive a call  " it's too far i wont deliver". You set your own perimeters and you could have at least shown the courtesy to call me in advance if that was a problem for you. Unserious establishment.
author: Server A.

description: Not worthy of their high prices.  I was so looking forward to former pizza but was delivered mall pizza from the food court
author: Michael B.

description:
I came here (the physical store) twice during my time in San Francisco - once at noon on Monday and once at 1:30 am that night. The pizza was just that good.

Food: I got an x-large (16 inch) pizza both times I went. They only have small (12 inch) medium (14 inch), and x-large pizzas. I had the Tijuana and the California pizzas, both of which were incredible! Of the two, I would recommend the California because the pesto and spinach toppings worked so well together on that pizza.

Service: The service is not roadrunner fast. In fact, it's probably average at best, despite the fact that my friends and I were the only ones in the store for lunch. The worker was patient with us while we tried to decide what pizza and even asked us if we wanted to change pizzas after we had already paid. However, because we went to the store both times (despite the fact that delivery is free), we did not get to experience their delivery service.

Interior: It is not spacious inside. There are a three round, tall tables with probably six chairs, and then you also had the option to sit along the wall, where there was another four chairs.

Pizza here is not the cheapest pizza in the world. I split the cost 4 ways and then 3 ways on my two visits here, respectively. On occasions when you're looking for some quality pizza, Bellissimo's is the place to go.
author: Jacob R.

description: I called to order a pizza and had to repeat everything multiple times to the guy taking the order on the phone.  After waiting over an hour and a half and after making three phone calls where I was assured the pizza would be here in 2-3 minutes, the pizza arrived.  After checking to see if the pizza was still warm, it turned out the entire pizza was bunched up in the middle of the box.  I refused to accept the pizza and sent it back with instructions to cancel the order.  What a huge disappointment.  Even the delivery guy wasn't surprised when I cancelled.  He knew how badly Bellissimo had failed on this order.  I won't be calling Belissimo again.
author: Jan M.

description: I ordered this and had it delivered to my hotel. The driver was very quick and even came right to my door (which isn't common in my experience, unfortunately). The pepperoni pizza itself was good, not great. If I order again, it would be because of the great service, not the food itself.
author: Matthew G.

description: I am an ex-NY'r who enjoys a good thin crust, fold-able, sausage, onion, garlic and meatball pizza.  I ordered Bellissimo through Uber eats which was very prompt in it's delivery.  The pizza was truly "meh."  The crust tasted like cardboard to me.  The sauce was heavily spiced and the pizza needed more sauce but then the spices would have made it overbearing.  The cheese had no real taste to speak of  and the sausage was the same.  The pizza was basically warm cardboard with sauce on it.  There was even sprinkled spices on it but it wasn't even across the pizza; it was heavy handed in two areas of pizza.  As you probably can tell I will not be ordering from Bellissimo Pizza again.
author: Mike K.

description: Really rather decent pizza. I've both had this for delivery, and eaten in here. Pretty good. This is one of my go-to late night option, especially for delivery.
author: John L.

description:
Your eating pizza at 2 am after so many beers you don't really know whats goin on. This will be just great. 

I'm on a quest to try all the main pizza places in the city. I've tried many. I like deep dish... I like thin crust - just depends on the day and how hungry you are.

Thicker crust than Pizzelle Di North Beach. Had a plain cheese pizza and pepperoni from both for comparison purposes.  More cheese, flavor and grease on Bellissimo. 

$5 min credit charge. Slice is inexpensive. The guys working here are great. Very friendly. If you order a single slice they will warm it up for you. I do miss the sort of cruch that Pizzelle Di North Beach has.

Tip: go for an entire pizza so its freshest.
author: Stefan T.

description: We've had really good luck with ordering pizza For delivery. Pizza is great and the order is always on time. So far so good
author: Cynthia H.

description: More of an FYI (there's no option to write a tip on the computer, and my phone is not handy): this place doesn't stay open until 3am, at least not anymore if it used to. There's a handwritten sign on the front that says it closes at 2am. I went around 2am expecting it to be open (based on the Yelp review, I should have fact checked this, however) and sure enough, the door was open yet there was a huge line in front of us being turned away. One patron (possibly intoxicated, so take this with a grain of salt) said out loud how she had been waiting for twenty minutes (which would have been within the store's operating hours that day) only to be told the place was closed once it hit 2am. If that's the case, that's pretty bad. Again, there may be more to this circumstance, so I'm not saying this is the gospel. I was disappointed either way. Note: their website does list 2am, so not the establishment's problem, but the Yelp listing should definitely be updated to reflect that. Hopefully can stop by next time before 2am.
author: Dan M.

description: I ordered takeout recently, it was on time and delicious! Way different when the people behind the oven, put more effort and love into each pizza coming out!
author: Keith Q.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised with the vegan selections at Bellissimo. 

They have quite a bit of options- I got the pesto, pineapple, tomato pizza and it was really yummy! The crust was perfect and probably one of my favorite parts! It was also very decently sized for a medium pizza! 

I would definitely like to have seen some sort of spicy options on the vegan pizzas! But overall very good, will go back soon!
author: Alexis H.

description:
Horrible experience! The delivery was 30 min late and there is no customer service at all.

Upd: changed to 3stars, cause pizza by itself was good
author: David V.

description: Called in a vegan pizza and it was ready when we arrived. So tasty! The crust was crunchy and the toppings were fresh, hit the spot!
author: Christina B.

description: Spinach pesto with pepperoni made me regret ever ordering from a national pizza chain. Delivery came early and super hot, fresh from the oven.
author: Garrett N.

description:
We did not do delivery. We went in to the store, ordered a pizza, and took it to go. The guys are so friendly, and I could see them making our pizza fresh. A whole pizza with "three" toppings (one premium and one regular) was around $23. Definitely fed two hungry people with leftovers. 

Smelled amazing, and people even stopped us on the street to say it smelled so good. Unfortunately, the taste was just average. The cheese wasn't as gooey or stringy as I'd like. But definitely hits the "pizza" spot. 

I'd go back here just because the people who work here are so friendly, just wish they could adjust the cheese on their pizzas a little bit!
author: Kat H.

description: Called to order three pizzas.... whoever answered the phone answered saying "yeah".... nothing else.... I thought I had the wrong number.... finally when established that this was the right place... they proved to still be very rude in trying to take my order.... waste of time... mind you it's only pizza, but know how to talk to your customers
author: E L.

description: We tried to order a small pepperoni pizza and the guys was charging us $19+  we kept asking if a small pizza was 11.75 like their sign says  + 1.00 for each topping it should be $13.00. Twice he pushed buttons on the register saying it was $20. After3 times of us explaining his own menu he then agreed it was $13 plus change. He was literally trying to overcharge us because it was 130am!!!
author: Karina G.

description: One of the good late night pizza options near nob hill! I love their Hawaiian and pesto pizzas. Could improve on the dining area and sauce options.
author: Kowshik M.

description:
Review based on delivery - extremely subpar

Pizza had zero character, though was hot upon delivery (+)

Sandwich was edible, though lacked in any of the promised cuts of meat

Cheese bread was more than disappointing - no flavor and likely processed foods
author: Aaron R.

description:
I love getting Bellissimo for late night food. I usually get the special or a combo with a large pizza, salad, and bread. My last time ordering from here I ordered while still on the way home from a night out. I got a call from the delivery guy, Muhammed, before I arrived home saying that he was outside. I apologized and told him I wasn't home, and he told me to just let him know when I was back. He went out of his way to make sure I received this pizza, which made it that much better when I finally did eat it. Bellissimo will now be my go to late night place to order from. 

Thanks Muhammed!
author: Josh W.

description: Good pizza. Ordered to our hotel for delivery. Pepperoni pizza was really tasty, but a tiny bit greasy. Delivery was quick. All in all, a good pizza.
author: Brian S.

description: decent pizza. nice people. good vibes. A bit expensive if you buy by the slice. open late.
author: Carter C.

description:
There was no vegetarian pizza at that time. There was only cheese pizza and other pizza with meat. So, I didn't want to buy, but the guy told me he can make it. So, he got the two old cheese pizza, put some veggies on them and sent them to the oven. 
Well, it was a good idea but the taste is not the same. The veggies where not cook well. They don't taste the same as the real fresh vegetarian pizza and I have ate them before here. 

Good try but it didn't work out. I did ate them after all...
author: Alberto W.

description:
OK, let me start by saying that I am not exaggerating in saying that the guy answering the phone and delivering have to be some of the nicest guys I have ever spoken to. I have no clue how they can be so cheery at 12:30 in the morning. 

I am writing this just to help them improve. I want them to be the best. Good things for good people. 

1. Awesome that they automatically include the parm and peppers for delivery but a few napkins would be appreciated. 

2. Change out the sausage supplier. 1/4 bites shouldn't result in me spitting out the sausage from all the extra silver skin or whatever that unchewable  substance is in the sausage. 

3. Put some sauce on the pizza. Crust, decent amount of cheese, and generous toppings but get some sauce on that thing. 

Ordering pizza delivery at 12:30 am and getting it hot within 25 minutes is a dream. Much appreciated and did the trick but if I could wish for more, you heard it.
author: JJ M.

description: Put an online order on Eat24. Everything was easy. The food came about 20 minutes late. The pizza was not to my liking. It wasn't bad or good. It was eh. Nothing special about it, nothing real good about it. Wouldn't eat here again.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Things you should know about me. 
I'm not a veggie guy. So I don't really know what the quality of all that is.

Imma be for real with my boys here. 

Negatives:

1. The sauce for pizzas has gone down in quality. 

2. The some guys or maybe just 1 guy doesn't understand English very well. So your order might get messed up sometimes. (Happened to me a few times.)

Positives:

1. The pizza's are good. The ingredients (besides the sauce) taste good. The crust isn't incredibly huge like other pizzerias. These have the normal thin crust that everyone should love. 

2. Wings are really good. They never disappoint.

3. The Italian panini is crazy good. (I get it with no veggies with light onions on it with pesto sauce.)

The only thing I'm on the fence about, is that pizza's have flower crumbs from being made on the bottom of the pizza. I'm not a fan but I know people who love it. So take that as you will. 

If you have more insight about other foods by these guys, please let me know. I'm down to try anything with meat and no veggies. El oh el
author: Kyle B.

description: *1st Disclaimer* -- I haven't been here physically, but their delivery pizza is amazing! *2nd disclaimer* -- we're vegan, soo we've only tried their vegan pizzas. It is so wonderful to have more vegan pizza options, and this pizza is delicious! I particularly like the spinach pizza with pesto sauce -- it's so good! That's all :)
author: Sam E.

description: Loud and obnoxious customers who play loud music, sing and scream at the top of their lungs and leave their trash all over the sidewalk after midnight. The employees do nothing to keep the noise down or the sidewalk clean and don't care if the neighbors are kept awake.
author: A B.

description: Great pizza, my favorite place near downtown to order from
author: Kevin B.

description:
I moved across the street last year and this has been the go to spot for a quick slice. Moving from NY, I've been trying to find a slice that's similar.

This isn't it, but they're decent. There's not much sauce and it's mainly dough and cheese, but the flavors are pretty good. The Bellisimo slice is a favorite of mine. The only gripe I have is that the prices are a bit steep for what it is.
author: Phil C.

description:
When not ordering by the slice getting a whole pizza will be made fresh for you. Yup it all started with a ball of dough!

We ordered a 14" medium Garlic Chicken Pesto Pizza...is listed on one of their specialties. This pie meshed well, I like it fresh and we got that. No greasy stuff, thank gawd. Pesto swirled, amazing! Chicken with the garlic tasted well.

We asked for extra grated cheese and crushed peppers to go, then we were told that we have those extras inside the pizza box, only to find one packet of cheese and one packet of crushed peppers?!? dang you suck.

Overall we enjoyed our pizza and when you finish a medium pie for two within an hour, its good. If you are looking for fancy gourmet styles go elsewhere. This place is like many city New Yorker pizza joints. 

QUICK TIP OF THE DAY: When drunken from a club or a bar? buy a quicky slice good or bad you wouldn't notice the difference but you will always say to yourself... man, that was good I'm getting sober now.
author: Jon B.

description:
Lovely.

Translated: translate.google.com/?ie=UTF-8&hl=en&client=tw-ob#auto/en/Bellissimo

Transferred: Baked white meat chicken pieces, melted parmesan, homemade marinara sauce and homemade focaccia. Grilled in the kitchen. Delivered to my mouth. Delicious success.

For $8 plus tax and deserved tip you get all this plus additional mozzarella or provolone come standard. Parmesan alone makes it great. More cheese just might make it brilliant.

Gentleman taking orders and making food was friendly and focused on his craft. He was also by himself which made the entire operation that much more impressive.

Love giving four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: This place is great when you've been at ace's down the street too long and just need to grab a slice to go. I enjoy the spinach pesto. I wouldn't really done in here as it's more of delivery or to go here with no servers or much of a seating area. It's not fancy super gourmet pizza but it's good and gets the job done!
author: Mary S.

description: I ordered their food off of uber eats because they said they were vegan friendly. after having a huge disaster of a delivery through uber, the pizza was delayed an hour. they heated up the pizza in the oven again when they knew our driver was coming so it wouldn't be cold, and that was about the only good thing I can say about them. the pizza was not vegan at all. without calling us to tell us they don't have vegan cheese or simply not accepting the request or informing us that they lack vegan cheese. so after waiting an hour, we were disappointed we couldn't even eat the pizza. they are not vegan friendly. vegetarian yes, vegan no.
author: Jesse B.

description: Good pizza and open late which is awesome. Location looks dingy but I think it added to the charm. Wish there was more places to sit down and wish they had a soda fountain instead of bottled stuff.
author: Angelina P.

description: I read the reviews and out of all the pizza places in San Francisco I thought I would give this place a try because it was close and convenient to where I was staying. I was going to stick with a slice because I wanted to give it a try before I got a whole pizza, but my boyfriend decided to get a whole pizza. We ended up getting the bellissimos special. The guy at the front was very nice and friendly and he said the pizza would  take 10 minutes, but we ended up waiting 20 minutes. Overall, the pizza dough tasted kind of bitter it was disappointing and the pizza was cold.
author: Nai S.

description:
I have been ordering through eat24 from this place for over 2 years now, and each delivery has been FLAWLESS. The longest I waited was 30min. Food was always warm. 

Beyond top notch service I really like that their pizzas are not too greasy yet flavorful.

5 stars, no hesitation.
author: Elph N.

description: Ordered through uber eats and the pizza was really sub bar. I would never want to order from here again.
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Overall it was delicious! They delivered straight to our hotel room! They were quick at delivering as well! Overall the food was delicious and amazing! I can't wait to have it again!
author: Javi P.

description:
AWFUL service. 
They will give an 1 hour estimate and take like 3 hours to delivery your pizza. If manage you call then (good luck trying), they will say "super busy".  Bullshit pizza and bullshit customer service.
author: tennyson p.

description:
Solid pizza. 

Love the California Special. It's so good. The typical cheese and pepperoni are tasty as well. Tomato sauce is good and the pizza dough is nice and soft. Good service as well, the guys there are friendly. 

It's a little pricey, but the taste is worthwhile. Also they're open late, so if you're hungry then it's a good spot to get some grub.
author: Samuel S.

description: A good pizza when you are traveling is like a good friend -- warm and welcoming and so satisfying. Bellissimo Pizza is just that. Enjoy'
author: Tom P.

description: It's nice after a long night out. Some girl almost fought me, but the pizza changed my mood. I ordered a chicken pesto pizza which hit the spot, would come again if someone tried to fight me.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Good pizza at a reasonable price. If you're craving a pizza it will satisfy, but nothing spectacular. Ordered a medium pep (enough for two with leftovers) and it served my cravings justice. Could have used more pepperoni and a better crust but that's just being me being picky. The Caesar salad was delicious though, them croutons were fab. 3.5/5 will visit again.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: We ordered using Door Dash. The pizza was not very good and the wings were just terrible. The wings had no flavor whatsoever and were pretty soggy.
author: Yogi K.

description:
I ordered pizza this past saturday for delivery over the phone around 4PM.  The guy that took my order was pleasant and got my order right (except for the delivery address) and told me it would take 20-25 minutes max for the delivery.  Here is what happened next:

1. Delivery took 1 hour - I didn't get a call to notify me that they were running late

2. The delivery guy went to a different address.  Not sure if the guy that took my order got the wrong address or what not, but ok fine I'll wait since it wasn't far from where I live

3. Pizza finally came and when I asked the delivery guy how I can pay for the pizza, he gives me a blank stare and tells me that I should have paid over the phone.  UMM ok??! How is that my job to know how I should have paid if it wasn't communicated to me when I placed the order.  I tell him I'm paying via CC so he tells me to call back and speak to the guy that took my order.  I tell him to hold on so I can get cash for the tip and then call the place.  I go back into the house and came back with tip $, when I handed over the tip $, he says "what's this?"  I tell him that it's his tip money so he starts to demand that I call the guy that took my order in front of him.  I tell him that I would get my phone and call.  He pulls out his phone and tries to call the person that took my order then AGAIN demands that I give him my credit card now.  Are you F'ing serious?? No way that I'm going to hand over my credit card to you.  Apparently the guy on the other line hangs up on him so he tells me to call him instead.  At this point no apologies from the delivery guy on how they F'D up big time and that the delivery took 1 hour but tries to put the pressure and blame on me.  I don't think so buddy!!  So I explain to him that as a BUSINESS, customers come 1st!  If you don't have guidelines/process on how to take orders and take payment, I'm sorry to tell you that it's not my F'ing job to figure that shit out for you.

My mom finally got fed up and we ended up giving him cash for the order.  At this moment, he apologizes (*bullshit)

Note to this business: If this is the way you treat your customers with blatant disrespect, you definitely won't get my business or my friends/family.  You just lost a local customer!
author: Mitu A.

description: I was visitng SF for the first time, and wanted late night pizza. This place was in the vicinity, and so I ordered for delivery. The pizza came at a decent time, and it was really spectacular. If you're a fan of thin crust pizza, this is the place for you. I ordered the San Francisco special (I forget the exact name), but it came with black olives, specialty pepperoni, feta, and some other good toppings. It was really delicious and hot and I would definitely recommend this place for a late night eat or just a quick bite.
author: Watsi E.

description: You want a pizza with hair on it? You want terrible service? Call them. I don't rate like this unless it's legit so trust me.
author: Coco B.

description:
Don't get some of the good reviews here. This was absolutely bar none the WORST pizza experience I've ever had so far (way worse than my last review of Royalty Pizza).

Ordered a large pepperoni the other night around 2 am. The pizza smelled very bad (like urine) and was not edible at all. My roommate couldn't even get past a whole slice. Ended up throwing it out and wasting about $20.

Again their pizza smelled like urine,eww. I have no clue what they do behind closed doors in their kitchen,but I don't think it's anything good. Go elsewhere! This place should be shut down. If I could give no stars I would,it's that bad.
author: Isabella A.

description:
talking about a bad pizza place...this must have the worst service in san francisco. 
I call to place an order and this guy picks up the phone and asks me what i want but i couldnt understand what he is talking about. So i look past that and just slowly talk and order my food....its an hour past and i call them and ask them where my pizza is and this guy tells me the driver is 10 mins away. its 10 mins, i call them and they just told me to wait. How bad is that?!?!

I live a block away and i cant leave my house cus i have a broken leg. thats y i didnt walk downstairs to get some better food. I will def never order from here again. smh. i hate this place.
author: Q W.

description: Delicious pizza, always hot and fresh!! Thin crust and flavorful sauce. My favorite is the Hawaiian. Family business, me and my boyfriend are definitely regulars.
author: Genevieve G.

description:
After a late night, our group ordered for delivery:
California Special
Garlic Chicken Special
Bellissimo Special
SF Special

5 stars for the quality of pizza and for the deliveryman who was able to locate our near-impossible-to-find hotel room.
author: Justin W.

description:
I stop by this place at least 4 times a week. It's a good, tasty and yummy pizza. My favorite is the grecko, but I recently fall in love with their california slice. I love that they are pork free pizza. It's all beef or turkey meat. I crossed their kitchen few times to use their bathroom. The kitchen looks decent and clean. Too bad they don't deliver to Oakland, since we don't live in the city anymore. 
Price wise, their prices are really  reasonable. 
About the staff, they usually very friendly and cheerful, although I believe everyone could have a bad moment, especially on busy time.
Bellissimo has been our favorite and we will continue beeing loyal.
author: Mahfoudh B.

description:
Visiting S.F. and did a night of "pizza by the slice" at three different establishments. None of them was better than Domino's (or Little Ceasar's, Round Table, or the like)...in fact, I'd give each of those chain establishments a 3.5. So, if you don't like those, you'll be even more disappointed than I was by these locally owned pizza places. 

All three rated only 3 stars, but each for different reasons. Bellissimo's slice went in the oven for a bit, but still came out a bit underwhelming. I'd read the review that said the dough/crust was "spongy", so I had pretty low expectations. I didn't find the dough to be spongy, but the bottom had a slightly crunchy texture...perhaps from going back in the oven, but unlike other reheated pizzas I've had. 

However, the cheese and toppings went closer to the edge, so not as much crust to deal with...and it tasted good enough. But, still, not better than Domino's, et. al.
author: Chris B.

description:
I juste read other reviews and can't believe I ordered from the same place. I used seamless.com to order, and used my credit card, no problem. 

I'm new to SF so I just went on seamless without reading reviews. I ordered a large chicken BBQ pizza and it was delicious!

Seamless stated it will take 45-60 mins for deliver, but the pizza was here in 20 minutes! it was hot and just right. It had tons of chicken and other topping, the crust was really good. Will definitely order again.
author: B G.

description: If you want consistent tasting pizza, I would not recommend this place. I've ordered cheese pizza multiple times from Bellissimo, and they somehow have managed to make it taste completely different every time. A few weeks ago, I purchased a few cheese slices and they tasted great: different from all the other similarly priced pizza places around town (a bit crispier), but had a perfect balance of sauce and cheese. In my most recent order, the pizza had a strange texture and little to no sauce - I could hardly finish a slice because it made me gag. It was like eating layers of funky tasting cheese on a crust that was too thick to be thin-crust, but too thin to be a normal crust. Not doughy at all like pizzas from other pizza places. I can only compare it to the cafeteria pizza I was served in high school... yikes. Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Anna C.

description:
Wow, this may have been the worst pizza I have ever eaten in my life.  And to make matters worse,  my friends and I stopped here after being on a party bus for the afternoon and drunk food supposedly is always good.  Well, Bellissimo Pizza definitely contradicted that notion. 

All I wanted was a hot, cheesy piece of pizza.  Instead I got a piece of cardboard with a sprinkle of cheese.  I ordered a slice from the available pizzas that just may have been sitting out all day.  I noticed that the cheese looked sparse, so I asked for extra cheese.  Even after asking for extra cheese, my end product boasted more more sauce then cheese!  Horrible.  The crust was like cardboard. Ewww.   

And then there were the hot wings - gross!  The meat was super fatty and the sauce was bland.  There was no spice to it at ALL!  I might have well just ordered some fat dipped in ketchup.

I will never go back, sober or drunk.
author: Kristen D.

description: To the lady who claims there is hair on the pizza: I tried a new pizza place in the city almost every weekend until I came across this pizzeria. That might be an accident as I always find falling little pieces from the pizza box on the cheese. That happens everywhere. I ve tried Bellissimo pizza few months ago and now I only order from them, with 98 health score trust me I think the odds are realllly slim to find hair on your pizza.
author: Tahar L.

description: This pizza is the best ever for me and my kids. We enjoy it any time especially when we are out. My kids they love cheese pizza, for me I love it all because I have tried every topic including the salad, sandwiches, chicken wings emm emmm emmmm emmm. their high score of inspection makes me feel more comfortable   also their friendly customer service with me and the kids.
author: Jean M.

description:
I love Bellissimo Pizza! When you first walk in you immediately notice how clean and charming the place is, it's very open, spacious and welcoming. I've been coming here for years and have tried pretty much everything on the menu, it's all good. The paninis are delicious, made on homemade focaccia and the pizza is awesome. My favorite is the California special: pesto, spinach, feta cheese and chicken yum! 
  
   The staff is friendly and their service is speedy, especially if you pop in for a slice of pizza. They even have a nice, varied selection of drinks to choose from. What other pizza place has Orangina and San Pellegrino?!
author: Kandi S.

description: Super FAST and DELICIOUS! Our office was in a tough spot. Our happy hour catering fell through, literally last minute. Bellissimo took care of us with 16 delicious pizzas.  We were a happy and well fed bunch last night. Thanks so much!
author: Luba P.

description:
After racking my brains for a good 4 minutes I honestly don't understand how anyone with functional taste buds rated this place over 2 stars - unless this is the first time in their life they are eating pizza and then I understand why it would be a transformative experience. 

Let me put this in perspective: late one night we ordered a combo pizza, pesto garlic bread, and chicken wings from this place, while under the influence of...uh...herbal supplements. And, knowing we were just ordering from whatever random place was still open in tendernob, we weren't expecting something earth shattering, we had low expectations. 

However, in spite of all these circumstances, when I took that first bite, my worst fear was confirme: this pizza sucks. i mean, every part of it was bad. The crust: blah. The tomato sauce: juvenile. The cheese: rubbery. The toppings: somehow even those were gross. As for the pesto garlic bread, it was pretty whatevs. The chicken wings were decent though.
author: Tailor A.

description: Bad pizza and bad neighbor! Loudly moving a new oven at 1am on a weeknight is rude to your neighbors.
author: Colleen H.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Bellissimo Pizza.

Pizza is just one of the foods that polarizes folks.  

Recently, I ordered from Bellissimo Pizza.  I really enjoyed it.  The pepperoni pizza was perfect for my personal tastes.   The crust was not too thick or too thin.  It was crisp but still had a nice chew and it had a nice bready flavor.  I also really enjoyed the sharpness of the sauce.  It just all came together very well.  Since my return to San Francisco, this is definitely one of my favorite pizzas.

The wings were just ok.  They were spicy and had decent overall flavor.  However, they had an oily texture that seemed like they had been fried in oil that was not quite hot enough.

Ordering was easy through Grubhub.  Delivery was prompt, professional, and polite.

Overall - their pizza and timely delivery earned them four stars.  and when i am feeling less adventurous and just want to order something i know i will like, i will order a pizza from Bellissimo.
author: Mark D.

description: Awesome delivery pizza. I think I've written one review before - made sure to give one here. If that is the norm for delivery, you cannot go wrong if you just want some Za!!
author: Tyler B.

description: Flavorless, sauceless. SPONGY??? Extremely overpriced pizza... West coast really does not know how to do pizza ... 3.50 for a regular size?? The size of my hand??? Seriously ??? Look at the pic.. Where is the sauce ???
author: Ian K.

description: Gotta try mushroom pizza! It's so good and crispy.
author: Julia R.

description:
Check out the monster veggie panini I got for $5.95!

Spinach, tomatoes, pesto, roasted peppers, onions, olives, artichokes and mozzarella piled onto a huge thick focaccia. Forget ordering pizza and stick with the paninis... They are cheap and good.  It was two lunches worth! And to guarantee that last star, it arrived at my work on time and hot.

No, I haven't tried the pizza, but it doesn't sound like I am missing anything. We will definitely order from them again and think you should, too.
author: Hayley W.

description: YUM. pizza was amazing. The crust was the best part. Tasted fresh and the guy working was super kind. Would be a local if i lived around here.
author: Kayla R.

description: So, not only did the delivery driver straight up ask me for a tip, but the pizza wasn't even sliced.  The pizza itself is fine - whatever recipe they use is fine, but the customer service and quality of product is much to be desired, although, in not surprised.
author: Mark R.

description:
A few years of college in and this is still my go-to place for late night pizza downtown.

I've never had a problem with the food, the staff are very friendly, and the prices are VERY reasonable. 

It is fairly small, but the noise level has never gotten out of hand while I've been there.
author: Lee S.

description: Decided to not deliver the pizza we ordered, not call, and just ignore us. What a disaster, and a joke.
author: Alexander K.

description:
I eat you because you are very very close to where I live. You satisfy my food wants, but not my food needs. Or wait, switch that. Or, um... 

Look, you make me full, but I don't love you. I like you.
author: Jess C.

description:
Decent pizza. I eat here a lot because it's close to my house, but if it weren't I don't think I would be a regular. 

Garlic bread is a joke, but the pizza is okay. I still haven't tried the paninis, but I hear good things.
author: Nikki B.

description:
It's nowhere near the best pizza in the city, but for late night delivery when you're hungry and other pizza places have closed,  it's really rather good.

The toppings (at least the meat) seemed a tad sub-par, but the pizza itself is well made, with a nice crisp thin crust - not so thin and soggy that it flops over limply, not so dry that it's a cracker.  If they used better meat, they'd probably be on my list of regular (non-late-night) pizza places.

Phone dude and delivery dude were both amicable - no grumpy 1:30am "what 'chu want?" phone greeting here.
author: T C.

description: We ordered from Bellissimo for our Halloween party .we got different kind of their combination pizzas  most of my friend like the California special ( Spanish ,feta cheese ,chicken & pesto).i prefer the plain pizza it's  classic New York style pizza.
author: Amore M.

description: Delicious. Extra toppings were very generous. Delivery guy parked and brought my pie up to the 5th floor. Very polite and friendly.
author: Gypsy L.

description: The worst delivery I've ever had. Cold food. Stale bread. Deceptive photos. Delivery man demanded a cash tip vs. a card tip. Do not waste your money.
author: Dane S.

description:
A solid 4 stars!!  We got a medium pizza this evening (8 good-sized slices), half with red onions & green bell peppers and the other half good ol' pepperoni - yum!  We ate happily at a little table outside alongside the restaurant on a warm October Friday evening.  

I'm sure we were great advertising for the place as we happily chomped through our pizza washing it down with a Coke.  Yum!  The pizza was *tasty*, the cheese (oh the cheese!) is what makes it so yummy, the crust was finely 50/50 crispy and dough-y = *yummy*! 

The guys are friendly, service was nice & this place is blocks away from my home -- what more can we ask for!  Oh and they deliver - yahooo (there's really no excuse for me though since I'm so close, but you never know)!  

Medium pizza+soda+tip+tax = $20
author: Maile N.

description: Whoa. Pretty much the most awful pizza I've ever tasted. The crust was gooey & abysmal; the sauce, flavorless. Delivered the chicken wings in a tinfoil lined container, which yanked most of the skin off each wing, and was then impossible to peel off the foil. Take this off your late-night options...not worth it.
author: Holly R.

description:
This review and rating is for california chicken and combo slices ($8), purchased at a reasonable hour :)

So, you know what sucks about living in a city where a cheap 1-bedroom apartment runs you $2500 bucks? That's right, Contestant #1! The correct answer is 'paying $2500 bucks for a 500 sq. ft.  apartment'.

Know what definitely does not suck? Living within 2 blocks of 4 markets, 4 or 5 decent-to-great restaurants, 2 or 3 coffee shops including at least one that's really superior, and (here's the point) TWO late night slice shops.

So, naturally I've tried Cybelles and Bellisimo. Just as naturally, I've been on the verge of blacking out every time I've done so, so up until now I haven't reviewed either, even though their pizza tastes like some kind of devine manna at midnight, or whenever you happen to be wasted. 

All that said, I made the leap today and bought some slices from Bellissimo without being intoxicated at all! Astonishingly, it's pretty damn good... and as you can tell from my other reviews, I'm actually kind of a foodie. Oh, and to be fair, I had a double bourbon before I actually started eating, because how are you ever gonna catch a buzz with two slices of pizza in your stomach?

it's important to understand pizza-by-the-slice. Of course they're a little cooler than I'd like, with a crunchy-hot crust from being reheated. Naturally, they're not quite as good as a fresh pizza. You have to take that into account when you review.

Crust was crunchy-tasty. Sauce was good, not too sweet or over-spiced. Toppings didn't look exceptional, but it turns out that they worked great together.

Pros: Fast (5 minutes in and out). Tasty. Affordable, but not what I'd call cheap. Open 'til 2am. 1 block from my apartment.

Cons: Slice pizza (might be fresh or stale depending on the luck of the draw). Toppings could be a little higher-rent.

I'll do it again, because it's easy, tasty, convenient and cheap...ish.
author: Dave T.

description: I Love  their whole wheat Cheese pizza! BEST PIZZA IN THE CITY!! :)
author: Andrea E.

description: This is now one of my favorite pizza joints to get delivery from in our area.  I have been trying to find one I really like and this place did a very nice job!  We had an extra large pepporoni and mushroom.  It was done perfectly and tasted delcious!  My only sadness was how long it took.  On a sunday night I know it can be busy but when it is over an hour when it states it will be 45-60 minutes, they should let me know before I have to call after the hour and look for the pizza.  Decent pricing.   Very tasty!
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
Quick and cheap. Not the best pizza I've ever had but okay... come Friday night, I'm tired from work and just want to crawl into sweats...I call Bellissimo. 

Super good cold or reheated :)
author: Katelyn E.

description: By far the worst experience ever!!! I order their pizza for delivery, and it took 1 hour and 40 mins to get to me when their place is less than 2 miles away. I called two times to ask for the location of my pizza and all the staff said was it is on the way. It finally arrive in a TAXI. How unbelievable!!!! I feel sorry for the taxi driver, he was only doing a favor for his friend. The pizzas were cold, the wings were dissemble and sticking to the foil. I called the pizza place again and try to complain, but the staff show no effort at all to help me resolve the problem, when I ask to speak with the manager on site, he told me management is not available and hung up on me. I called a second time and ask for his name, he said " I DON'T CARE YOU STUPID FUCKING BITCH!!!!" i can not believe I'm getting this kind of service these day.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Eat 24 advertised delivery time- 45 minutes. 90 minutes after ordering, I'm still waiting. Contacted Eat24 half an hour ago (at the 60 min mark) and was told it was out for delivery. Either they were lying or their delivery guy took off on a scenic drive.
author: Heather K.

description: This review is way over due, I tend to forget about Yelp, but since I had to rate and review Tortilla Kitchen today, I was looking over my reviews and saw that I hadn't mentioned anything about the hot wings here, since I tried them months ago.  AND HAVE NOT ORDERED THEM AGAIN......LOL  Yeah, they were blah, no flavor, flabby skin, just skip it, don't order them, if you must have pizza and wings, order the pizza here, because it's amazing and order the wings from Double Deckers, hands down the best wings in the city.
author: Jason B.

description: Late delivery AND wrong pizza. Busy or not... What kind of business is that? Ordered awful chicken pesto... Got pepperoni. I was so hungry I took it. But ... Really?!
author: Elisa T.

description: The pizza here is just alright. It's kind of a dingy place with unfriendly service and  I think $4 for a normal sized slice of pizza and $1.25 for a can of soda is quite pricey. Definitely not amazing; just very very mediocre and meh. Won't be coming back again unless I'm starving and have no other options.
author: Rinda K.

description:
A great place to go to satisfy my pizza-craving. I usually get a slice, or two, of pepperoni.

The TV is usually playing a soccer game.
author: Anthony N.

description: This pizza place is AMAZING!! I don't know who wouldn't want to go here. Lotfi, Mohamed, Alfredo are the best!
author: Michelle C.

description: It has been an hour and twenty minutes since I placed my order... the estimated delivery time was 40-60 minutes...  When I called to check on my order I got neither an apology nor an explanation.  I will probably not be ordering from this place again, and I will be lucky if I even get the overpriced-but-extremely-late-and-probably-cold pizza that I ordered ages ago at all.
author: Holly E.

description: The pizza here is HELLA Bellisimo! Seriously great stuff the Cali special is amazing with the house made pesto mixed with red sauce. It gets a bit busy late night and post bar so it's a good idea to call in an order. Garlic bread with pesto and cheese is an amazing filler at 4.50
author: Todd G.

description:
Delivery review:

While living in Soma on Howard, we lived on this pizza...When a late night delivery was required.... always good.
author: Lowell Z.

description: Ordered late night from the westin hotel which is just around the corner. They wouldn't take credit on delivery and said they could only take my card over the phone. They never actually showed up. Im excited to call visa and charge back with extreme bias. Avoid this place.
author: Kyle C.

description:
QUALITY:

Decent for the price.  

DELIVERY:

I've been a long time customer but I won't be ordering from them any longer.

I just wanted a pizza tonight.  My ankle is hurting from an injury months ago and tired from the long day, I decided to order some food.  I wait about an hour, and finally get a call from the delivery guy.

He says that the security guard came to him and told him he couldn't park on the fire lane in the roundabout.  This, I realize immediately, is a lie.  Been here 6+ years, and everyone has always parked there for hours at  a time, myself included, while moving groceries in and out, and so forth.  Hours---I highly doubt a security guard, who is even rarely seen there, would tell him THIS NIGHT that he couldn't stay there for a minute.  But ok, this is beside the point---to continue...

I explain the situation, saying I can't walk on my foot right now, so I can't come down, and wonder how the situation can be fixed.  He proceeds to raise his voice at me, telling me how I told him the same story months ago about my ankle being injured.  Clearly this guy has never had an injury.  

Long story short, after speaking to someone from Seamless, he declined to deliver the pizza and they issued me a refund.

Seriously, SEAMLESS SAVED THE DAY.  It was nice to talk to someone professional, especially after having a stranger with my home address shouting at me and calling me a liar.  I think I'd be a lot more perturbed at this point ...
author: Rosanna S.

description:
Meh, mediocre pizza and it was delivered cold. 
Affordable at least.
author: Kat H.

description:
Thank u guys! U r the best in SF. That's why I stop by every time I come to the bay area. The pizza always yummy, nicely cooked and hit the spot. My wife and I are always amazed by the great food and the friendly staff, even at 2 am.
Also, their pizza and service quality have always the same standards, no matter who's working.
Their delivery service is pretty fast and their drivers have always good manners. I have been loyal to this place since they opened. I wish they have a second one in southern Cali, so I could have enjoyed their Pizza more often. 
Moneywise ,their  price are pretty affordable. SO your pocket won't ever be hurt :) :).
Well done guys!!!! Looking forward to stop by again.
author: Mahfoudh J.

description:
their california n garlic chicken r pretty dope 
i always have these two
author: Alex L.

description: Way over priced for the quality. 2 slices and a coke was over 10$. You can get better pizza in the neighborhood for a better price.
author: Bryce P.

description: This place sucks, waited for over two hours for my pizza to be delivered, used it eat 24.  Would never go to them again!
author: J B.

description:
yuk! frozen spinach, strore bought tasting crust. 

good deal, but won't be eating (from) here again. 

"best pizza i've had in the city"??!?!  someone needs some REAL pizza! 
unless you're dying of hunger, don't do it...
author: Wendy X.

description: Nothing to write home about but if you're nearby and you're craving a slice of pizza then this place should satisfy that hankering. There's limited seating, the place is very dirty and its not even that great of a deal. Really, Bellissimo just fills the niche for nearby pizza.
author: Vivian A.

description:
VERY solid New York Style slice in the Tendernob. Really friendly guys working here, too.

I had to laugh when I read one or two negative reviews complaining about the "greasiness" of the Pizza, LIKE THAT'S A BAD THING WHEN YOU'RE CRAVING A LATE NIGHT SLICE??!!

Do not hesitate to check this place out, with the recent addition of Bite sandwich shop next door this little corner of Sutter Street has become a destination for inexpensive (but tasty) late-night grub!
author: Mike J.

description:
I don't know why so many people are hating on this place. While visiting my favorite city we stayed at the Hotel Vertigo and were looking for a pizza place nearby because we were lazy, had the munchies, and wanted to eat in. All the reviews for pizza joints in the area were pretty bad so we decided to take a chance on Bellissimo.

While the guy who took the order was not very personable and had a thick, non-Italian accent, he got our order correct, including our thin crust request, and even offered us a few ways to combine things to save a few bucks. 

We ordered a pepperoni pizza, thin crust, with a dinner salad. He mentioned one would be enough for two people. They delivered it to the door pretty quickly. The pizza was super hot when it arrived. Everything was correct and even though we forgot to ask for things like utensils, they included those, napkins, parmesan cheese, pepper flakes, and dressing. The only thing I can complain about were that the cucumbers in the salad could have been fresher. Everything else in the salad (iceberg lettuce, green olives, tomato, onion, and some greens) was fresh and perfect. The pizza crust did get hard after it sat for a while. Maybe that's why people were complaining about it being like cardboard or from the freezer section. I would recommend getting a thinner crust in the future. The cheese on the pizza was so good, salty, greasy, just like a pizza joint should be. Everything came out to about $17 and we gave a $4 tip. 

We were really surprised at all the bad reviews. I have not been inside, only briefly walked by the actual place, so I can't comment on that.

I'm satisfied with the food I got for the price I paid.

Don't let the bad reviews fool you and give this place a try.
author: Catalina V.

description:
A perfect crust and a delicious pizza sauce is all it takes to make the perfect slice. I love pesto chicken, but when I decide to go vegetarian I always go for the regular pesto with red onion on top. They don't have it in the menu but they don't mind make it special for me thank you very much and I apologize for taking too much time to decide while a bench of people waiting behind me in line. 
I'll be back soon
author: Roofa M.

description: Shouldn't late-night pizza always taste good? I guess I'm holding Bellissimo to that standard, so it really was just a flat line for pizzaness. I had their standard combo and it was more on the cardboard crisp side than I usually prefer. I don't like pizza to be dripping with grease, but the pizza slice was on the dry side. Will probably hit them up again if I crave a slice in the wee hours, but very underwhelming.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I've had pizza in at least 10 different states, most of them on the East Coast (NC, SC, VA, MD, DE, PA, DC, NJ, NY, WV, OH, CA). I've had a lot of different styles of crust (thin/crispy, thick/doughy, thin/foldy), styles of sauce ("white", sweet marinara, one with lots of herbs and spices, etc), different toppings, though my go-to is Pineapple and real (not Canadian) bacon, or plain cheese.

Bellissimo's does Pizza by the Slice, or made to order whole pizzas. Rarely do I get a PBTS, unless I'm drinking, which is usually how I find these local pizza joints anyway (I'm looking at you, Angelo's in Dover, DE, across from Irish Mike's and that one place in Chester, PA near that uh... one bar... yeah, I was pretty drunk and don't remember the name of either, BUT their 420 pizza topped with chopped chicken tenders, sliced mozzarella sticks, and french fries was awesome!).

I digress. I unfortunately did not find this one by stumbling into it at last call and ordering by the slice. For 3 days, walking between Hotel Vertigo and Union Square, I passed it and finally decided to check it out. I ordered a whole pizza because of price, really. I could eat a 12" by myself in the course of a late afternoon through the night. I only saw Canadian bacon on the menu for the Hawaiian, so I asked the guy behind the counter if they had real bacon. He grinned and chuckled a little bit because he understood I considered Canadian "bacon" to be Not Real Bacon. Skipping the meat, I went for a cheese and pineapple. Pineapple goes really well with mozzarella and pizza sauce, even without the meat.

Service was fast, I tipped their jar. Brought two doors down to my hotel room. This pizza was LOADED with cheese! Yes! I LOVE pizza places that aren't stingy with mozzarella. The crust wasn't too thick or doughy, not too soft or too hard. It was nice and chewy, the sauce wasn't overpowering, and the cheese did that wonderful stringy effect when you pulled a slice away from the pie... and WITHOUT the pool of grease on the top! How did they... ? Black magic, I say.

The first bite was heaven. The second and third bites were even better. Before I knew it, I had eaten half of the pizza. 

Best pizza in the city? Very probable. This is quite possibly one of the best pizzas I've ever had. Tenderloin has some very, very good local eats, and probably one of the only reasons to come to this district (unless you enjoy being panhandled by the homeless, of course).
author: Meg S.

description:
Mediocre SF Pizza.

Got the Sausage, Mushroom, and Onion pizza. It came in a reasonable time, and it was hot.

Hard to find a great delivery pizza in this city.
author: Eric S.

description: The three star reviews posted here are deserved, the pizza tastes a bit warmed over and isn't a reinvention of the pepperoni-delivery medium, I'm more pleased that they're open late in that part of the Tenderloin. They saved me from starvation, and they get an extra star for that alone. Never close early!
author: Kevin B.

description: Eh. Just got the combo slice; was charged $4 and wasn't particularly impressed in any way. Maybe I should have ordered something else.
author: Clara H.

description:
It's OK.  Man, I've reviewed so many San Francisco pizza places that I don't really have anything interesting to add.  But since my interesting stories usually involve a pizza place's shortcomings, that might work out in Bellissimo Pizza's favor.  Or not.

It's decent.
author: John S.

description:
Quick, big, and easy! JUST THE WAY I LIKE EM! haha ;)

On a real note, I was in the area looking at studios and apartments, found this place on Yelp and tried it out. Small little shop next to a liquor store and a cafe. Got 6 slices: 2 supremes, 2 pepperoni, and 2 CA specials. 

I LOVED the California Special! Pesto, Tomatoes, Chicken, Spinach, and Feta Cheese! Really yummy!

The slices are big, but not too huge to where you feel sick afterwards. The pizza has just the right amount of sauce and is not too greasy! 

Overall, I most definitely will be back and will try their paninis (this place is open til 2am!) . I'll also make sure to try the crepes that the cafe makes next door!
author: KimberLy M.

description: Pizza is just OK, and they don't even heat it up for you.  Staff is borderline rude and you have to ask for your change back.
author: jeremy d.

description: I also got a late delivery and the wrong pizza!!!!! c'mon!!!! I was hungry!! argh argh!!!
author: Chris Z.

description:
This review is for late night slices... have not tried freshly made pizzas which may well be good.

At about 1am I came to this place and got two slices, it tasted like old melted plastic, probably from the heat lamps. Never have I had such bad pizza I had to throw it away. 

So just make sure you get fresh pizza or examine how fresh the slices look
author: Mark G.

description:
Two friends and I chose to order a pizza and salad from Bellissimo since it was right next to our hotel.  We got the pizza with chicken, pesto, spinach, and feta.  YUM!  It was so tasty.  Perfect amount of crust, cheese, and they did not at all skimp on the chicken.  We ordered a Greek salad which was just okay.  With the yelp discount, all of it was $22.

The cashier was ok.  Not thrilled when I mentioned the yelp discount.  But he happily gave us paper plates, napkins, and utensils to enjoy our meal in our hotel room.

They also sell by the slice, which is of course convenient.  

Yum!
author: Jenna C.

description: I needed a late night dinner convenient to my hotel (Hotel Vertigo) so went next door to this pizza place.  The paninis sounded good so I got the Chicken Parmesan one as well as the caesar salad and garlic bread.  The caesar salad was okay but I would recommend NOT getting the garlic bread - it was dry and not buttery or garlicky.  The panini was a decent size but did not have very much flavor.  The Chicken Parmesan was not as such - it was sliced chicken with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese, not really chicken parmesan in my opinion.
author: Marta D.

description:
Best pizza-by-the-slice in SF!

Especially greco.

Plus, they are open late and the staff are always very nice.

On the downside, a tad pricey ($4 a slice) but worth it!
author: John C.

description:
We had Bellissimo deliver to our scary Best Western motel after we decided we were too buzzed and tired to drive to the Mission for Mexican food. 

So. I have to say that 
1.) they were very friendly 
2.) delivery was reasonable fast for a Saturday night 
3.) the California Special with feta cheese, chicken and pesto sauce was quite delicious and soothed my scary motel nerves nicely. 

The also brought some garlic bread which unfortunately arrived quite scorched and some Orangina! I have never had the pleasure of delivered Orangina! Right on!

Truthfully we didn't have anything else but I ate 4 pieces and felt like a little sick and stuffed afterwards from my gluttony. 

Anywho, they deliver late, to your house and scary motels! A win in my book!!!
author: Shelley V.

description: Tried this place twice. We ordered pizza slices the first time. And it was ok. Not that bad but obviously better when fresh. The next time we ordered a whole pizza. It was fresh and delicious. I think for future reference, it is much better to order a pizza than to grab a slice. BUT it is in a decent location and has great hours and is very quick to just pick up a slice.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Bellissimo's is one of the best pizza places around. I like to get the Bellissimo deal which is a XL Pizza 2 topping and 2 liter soda for $16. 

They deliver till 3 am which is late and that's always nice. There always very friendly. I have heard one new guy isn't the nicest but I haven't met him yet. 

There wings are not bad either, really hot and spicy but very good.
author: Toby H.

description:
INCREDIBLY AVERAGE

    I ordered from Bellissimo late on a Friday night and was completely underwhelmed. First off, the delivery was not prompt and as a result the food was not very warm. Beyond that, though, the cheese panini that I ordered looked and tasted NOTHING like a panini. Instead, it tasted like they just stuck two pieces of pizza together and called it a panini. 
    On the upside, this place delivers pretty late, so if you really need a late-night pizza fix, Bellissimo might suffice.
author: Paige M.

description:
I had this review in mind last night, but am writing this today almost 24 hours later. 

I called for a takeout of their awesome Tijuana special. I asked if the pizza can be made thin crust. Without any hesitation, they accepted it and delivered spot on. The thin crust which is not on the menu was made to perfection for no extra cost. 

The pizza never disappoints here and the same goes with the customer service. 

Within these 24 hours and few hours after i picked up my pizza, one of the employees was stabbed to death in what seems to be a freak homicide. A definite tragedy. All the employees and the owner were very friendly people. 

Thanks and Condolences .
author: Karthick S.

description:
I love them THIN pizza! Always order the pesto pizza! 
There was a time when we'd always, always order pizza from here just before its closed. it used to close at 3 AM. 
Pizza arrives in 15min and we'll happily munch, munch, and munch! 
Definitely a good place to order food from when you're drunk and you want food!
author: Miss C.

description:
MMMMMMMM finger lickn good! I don't know how generous I am about giving out 5 stars, but I sure don't give them out like candy on Halloween.

WHY I LOVE BELLISSIMO
-delivery is PRONTO, it comes pippn hot and crispy
-the delivery guy is so nice, whenever he forgot something, he would actually go back and bring it to me. 
-cheappppp good pizza
-closing time is 3AM

Wherever I go, Bellissimo will always have a place in my heart.
author: emily g.

description:
I'd probably give this place 3.5 stars if I could, but a 3 would be more accurate than a 4.

I found this place on Yelp after craving some late-night thin-crust pizza on a Friday night. I called my order in for delivery, and mentioned the 10% Yelp discount. They delivered within 30-40 minutes, and the pizza definitely hit the spot. I did have to remind the driver of the 10% discount, since they forgot to apply it...nice try. A medium "combo" cost $18 after the discount, so it wasn't particularly cheap, but I was desperate. It wasn't the best pizza in the world, but I did enjoy it at the time.

A 3 might be a little harsh, but I just can't give it a 4. That being said, I'd probably order from this place again if/when I'm desperate for some pizza.
author: John C.

description:
People, please.

I expect more from my fellow Yelpers.  I don't understand how this can be a four star pizza place.  I'm baffled.

The wings were limp, lifeless and -- shudder to think -- served with *ranch* dressing.  Not a carrot or celery stick in sight.  We, as a nation, deserve better than this.

The pizza was dry and speckled with sausage bits that looked like shrunken turds.  They tasted fine and all, but they were just dry.  The crust was tasteless and hard.  And the sauce had no personality.

Yelp, you have led me astray.  How can I regain my trust in you?
author: Smog R.

description:
Quality is like those 99cents frozen Mr P's pizzas from the frozen section @ safeway.

Yuck. I don't understand the 4 star rating on here.

I give them two stars because I didn't have to cook tonight for the inlaws.
author: Lily S.

description: Stopped by for a quick bite to share a slice of Californian pizza, which came with pesto and chicken, which I'd recommend. The slices were sitting in the front of the glass display, and they popped it in the oven quickly to heat it up before serving to me. The pizza flavors were alright, could have used a little bit more time in the oven. Slice was $4.00.
author: Alex R.

description: I'm a pizza snob from the east coast so all west coast pizza is pretty subpar compared to what I'm used to. That said, this place is acceptable. Let's put it this way: I've ordered from there four or five times because it's a block from my apartment, but I'm constantly looking for a better pizzeria to replace it.
author: Bianca F.

description: I was NOT expecting much from this place based on the reviews but it was late, I was hungry, and I had timed out of all my default restaurants-that-deliver options. So, I was pleasantly surprised by prompt, friendly service, and really decent food! Ordered through Eat 24 Hours and got two different paninis (vegetarian and a tuna melt) and a medium spinach/pesto/feta pie. The paninis looked a bit small, but were tasty, had a generous amount of filling and the pie was good as well! Well done! I would definitely try them again for their paninis - nice to have sandwich options on their menu.
author: Barbara K.

description: Ordered delivery at 1230 and it came in about 25 minutes which is pretty good.  The delivery guy was silent and unappreciative of the $4 tip I gave him.  Don't need much but "thanks" would be nice sine I was staying a a hotel which was only 3 blocks down.  The pizza wasn't anything special, but it was good.  They are open really late and delivered fast.
author: M. B.

description:
They don't have much to offer for walk-ins but I actually liked this pizza better than most that I've tried in the area. Sober. 

Being from New York my tastes in pizza are high but I liked the way they cook their crust; its crispier than most around here. 

I will most likely order a pie from here in the future.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Worst pizza I have had.   Each time I have had it, my stomach is in bad shape.  Store smells and it reaches out to street.
author: Jeanne B.

description: I always order from these guys, because they're right up the street.  They're always friendly and fast.  They may not have the most authentic pizza, but it's still great!  It hits the spot every time.  Their prices are reasonable too! If you're in the area and want pizza, this is a great place.
author: Rachel P.

description:
I've grabbed slices at Bellissimo a few times, and it's probably the best by-the-slice pizza in the Civic Center/Union Square/Nob Hill area.  That's not saying much, but it really hits the spot.

A few nights ago I also ordered delivery from there.  It's no Uncle Vito's, but after 11:00 neither is Uncle Vito's because they close so damn early.

Anyways, I ordered my standard small cheese and a greek salad.  The pizza was decent, although the cheese didn't seem to be the best quality.  The salad was also ok, it could have used more veggies (especially tomatoes).

Delivery was fairly quick, which is nice.
author: Joseph N.

description:
The owner took the time out to directly apologize to me about the incident that happened a few nights ago. I don't think that one bad delivery guy should affect his business because that wouldn't be fair.

All in all, it's a good pizza place. Great tasting pizza at a reasonable price.
author: Charmaine A.

description:
HAHA I can't exactly remember my experience here but I will try my best.

After a night of silly-ness and drunken hugs and kisses at Aces and a good 12 shots in my tummy I neeeeded some carbs. We walk down and I spot PIZZA in neon lights and the lights were on. I'm there.

I go in. A very tall very nice dark gorgeous and funny man behind the counter just strikes up a conversation with me. He asks where I'm from and I tell him South America. He asks what country and I say you probably will never guess. I ask the same and he says North Africa. I ask what country and he says I'll never guess. I ask where the bathroom is and he points to the back. 

I come back and my pizza is ready for me with a sprite. I said I didn't order sprite and he just smiles. In the end he couldn't figure out what country I was from and he told me where he was from but I couldn't quite hear him... but I went along with it.

At that point any pizza place would have sufficed but I enjoyed the free sprite and our little convo. 
Will I be back? Not unless I'm a super drunky-bear and walking back from Aces. Which I'm sure will be quite a lot.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I like to put a slice of pizza on top of a night of drinking. It seems to absorb the bad stuff and help me sleep.

I came in here after the Minx debacle mostly because it was just up the street but also because I'd never been before. I was going to pass two other places on my way to the buss stop.

Out of the three pizza by the slice places I know of in the area this one is the best, a little better than Irving Pizza on Geary and far superior to the disgusting Napoli Pizza on Polk St.
author: Manny F.

description:
These guys get the "Heart Award".  

I walked in tonight and asked them if they made a chicken parm sandwich....yeah, I know it's the 4th of July but that's what I wanted.  

They kinda all looked at each other and said they could do it, even though it wasn't even on the menu.  

It took forever.  I started to get annoyed.  Drunk idiot after next barked pizza slice orders while I sat on the stool waiting for my damn sandwich while watching everyone else get their food.  

Then Mohammed called me up (I had plenty of time to get to know him) and handed me a heavy bag.  I said "thanks" half-heartedly and walked out.  The charm of my "special order" had worn off.  

I got home and opened the bag to not only find one, but two of the single best chicken parm sandwiches I've ever had.  Seriously.  They were masterpieces.  They didn't have rolls so they used folded pizza dough.  Grilled green onions, a generous heap of melted cheese, their awesome marinara, a fat breast of chicken, spices.  

Right now I feel like a dick, but a full, satisfied dick.  Sorry for doubting you, Bellissimo Pizza guys.  I'm writing this now to tell you that was literally the single best late-night meal I've had in ages.  

If this thing doesn't wind up on the menu then this review was for nothing.
author: Ted T.

description:
Been here a few times, pizza's pretty good for a cheap, late night place & close to my apt. 

Made the mistake of trying a sandwhich today and waited 20 minutes! No one else was even in the restaurant!!! Realize it was a toasted paninni, but think I'll be sticking with the pizza from now on.

Also try Milan Pizza on Geary, 2 blocks deeper into the loin but pizza's probably the best in the neighborhood.
author: Nick T.

description: Got a pie delivered for the AFC and NFC games. Came within the promised 30-45 minute range. Really friendly delivery guy. Pizza was pretty alright. Not amazing but by no means bad. While it was a little underdone the dough was good enough for it not be a huge issue. The mozzarella was little stringy/rubbery but still delicious. Peperoni and pineapple tasted great. They thoughtfully included pepper flakes and parmesan without a specific request--not everyone does. Most importantly its pretty cheap. $17 plus tax and tip for an xtra large (16") Hawaiian is deal. I'll order around for the time being but Bellissimo is on my radar as a potential pizza delivery regular.
author: Quentin J.

description:
Frankly, I love this place.  

I recall many other Italian places and Pizza Shops  that have been in this space on Sutter @ Hyde (There is a #2, #3, #4, and #76 MUNI Outbound Stop at the Door, the #27 (To Van Ness) Stops across the Street).  But this is one has the best pizzas ever!  If you went when the former owner had it try again you will be pleased at the improvement.

I was amazed at how good their pizza is!  When you walk in check out the ready to go slices, but be fast.  It is not uncommon for many people to come in at once.  

Last night three pizzas were ready and in five minutes they were all gone.  If you get  a slice you will probably want a second one, if you wait one of the herd will grab it and you will have to wait for a fresh one out of the oven.  I saw about 15 slices sold in five minutes no kidding!

Who goes there?  locals, tourists, Academy of Art Students, Retired people, the mix is very San Francisco.

Last night I had three slices since I missed lunch and dinner.  The guys there are great and have great customer service!

The place has inside and sidewalk seating.  With all deference to my ex who loved North Beach Pizza, this is better and cheaper.  The crusts are never burned or overly dry, the condiments are fresh.  If you are into garlic try their garlic slice (but not before a date), it is the most pungent garlic slice I ever had.  I simply love their classic cheese slice, it is exceptional.  The spinach and feta is wonderful...

There is a late night market next door (Yogi Market) that has about the same hours, so you can grab a pizza and whatever you need just next door both are open till 2AM...

It is open late and great if you need a bite after partying, if you go in sober the food will taste great.
author: Tom B.

description: It's the best pizza place within two blocks of my apartment. They keep pesto chicken pizza ready to go, which is a nice touch. The guys are super friendly and service is always great.
author: Monika M.

description: This place was literally next door to us at the Vertigo and so we had a late night pizza.  I asked for Margarita, and they said they don't have it.  so much for authentic Italian pizza by the slice eh?  Anyway, we ended up having a cheese pizza and a pepperoni pizza.  It was good.  Nothing to rave about, nothing to rant about.
author: Rox G.

description: I don't know how this place has good reviews. I ordered a late night pizza for delivery and over an hour later it still hadn't been delivered. I had to call and see if they were actually coming. The guy on the phone was nice, but couldn't really give me any useful information. The pizza finally came and all I can say was that I forced myself to eat a slice. It was terrible compared to all the other pizzas you can order in this city.
author: Elli S.

description:
The pizza Bellissimo serves is, at least, better than what the previous owners sold.  Do not get the wings!  If you want soggy disgusting wings, the ones at Dominos are at least drenched in a tasty hot sauce.

It's all about proximity.  Don't go out of your way to eat here.  But if you're only a couple of blocks away, you could do a lot worse.  I'm talkin' to you, Cybelle's!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Lazy Sunday. Past 10pm. Yelp search for places that deliver. Based on the reviews, I call Bellissimo. I have no menu, so I ask for a medium pizza, but upon hearing how many inches this is, I change the order to a large. 

When the pizza arrives, a tad on the late side, but not enough to be a deal, the delivery dude apologizes profusely, saying that they were unsure whether I had wanted a medium or a large, so they made and brought us both sizes, charged us for one. :-o
