Pizza rocks. Wings rock. Delivery dude wearing AC/DC shirt. And they're open til 2am. 

This is our new pizza place. Thanks, guys!!
author: SheRat R.

description:
I'm fortunate that my home away from home is a block away from Bellissimo.  Today I went in with my boyfriend who often stops in for a quick and tasty slice.  I was trying hard not to be tempted by the delicious pizza, so I informed him I was going to go next door for a healthier sandwich.  The guy behind the counter overheard me and mentioned that they make sandwiches as well, but that they're just not listed on the menu. 

I was skeptical about a sandwich that didn't make the menu board, but I figured I'd give it a try.  I decided on a turkey sandwich with lettuce, tomato, red onion, green bell pepper mustard and mayo.  To my pleasant surprise the large sandwich, which was made on their homemade focaccia bread, was grilled to perfection on a panini press.  I also took a side of their homemade pesto to try on the sandwich.  OMG- it was delicious!  It was flavorful and not super oily like I find most pesto sauces to be.  

I would have given this place four stars for their quality "fast food", but they earned a fifth star for their genuinely nice staff.   I truly appreciate that they are honest and will let you know which pizza slices are the freshest.  They clearly take pride in the food they make, the space is clean, their pricing reasonable, and they always smile.
author: Michelle M.

description: I like authentic chicago syle pizza. The pizza here was ok, on par with a pizza hut, but not for pizza aficionados. The wings were terrible. Soft, soggy, fatty and bland. The garlic chicken pesto toppings were ok, but the crust was mediocre.
author: Jen J.

description:
Not only are they open late, they will deliver to me without judgement even though I live around the corner.  Yes.  I have them bring it to me.  THAT'S HOW I ROLL ON OCCASION.

When I do get off my lazy ass, I do go in for my Vitamin G(rease) after a late night at the bars.  It has saved me from many a hangover.

It's also tasty when sober.  But it's best when you need to absorb that last vodka tonic.
author: Dottie G.

description:
fair warning: i have usually only visited bellissimo after a few...ahem...drinks...

on that note, the pizza is awesome and totally hits the spot! the guys that work here are always nice and the pizza is quick and easy. 

totally basic, but still good, greasy pizza that helps you soak up anything you may have drank before.
author: Ameigh F.

description: Good fast delivery and flavorful pizza
author: T B.

description:
Classic pizza by the slice joint: choose your slice from the display, they heat it in the oven, and you eat it in your mouth.

Overall not bad at all. They had the basic cheese, pepperoni, and combo. They also had pesto and a pesto/chicken.

The taste was there in the toppings, and the crust/cheese was pretty good...but...the sauce and its taste was lacking.
author: Varun ..

description: Actually, one of the worse pizzas that we have ever had was from there tonight (February 19th). We ordered Bellissimo's special for home delivery. Instead, they send us a  a cheese pizza by mistake. And their cheese is flavorless and artificial. I could get a better pizza from Dominos or any of the chains!!!  Finally almost two hours later, they delivered the right pizza--which was cold as ice. Their web site does not take credit cards--need to get with the times!!  You could not pay me to order another pizza from this place. Seriously, one of the worst pizzas that I have ever eaten in my life!!!
author: Finnegan M.

description:
Great pizza, especially good after an evening of boozing it up. I've been here quite a few times in the last few weeks and these guys are so awesome... Always smiling and cracking jokes even when their little pizza shop is full of drunken assholes at 2am!
___________________

The sweetest guys ever. So bummed to hear about the tragedy that transpired early yesterday morning. Condolences. :(
author: Donna V.

description:
BELLISSIMOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!

So so so yummy!  I love this place (bearing in mind I have eaten here a lot - but always when I am rather tipsy, *ahem*...) and it is so convenient that it stays open so late!

Perfect after a night of drinking at Minx! :)  I would also recommend ordering pizza after many margaritas at Minx and then insisting that your boyfriend's slice is yours and eating it (and not remembering in the morning...)!

They have loads of yummy toppings and the service is super quick.  The pizza is so cheesy and delicious and flavoursome....mmmmmmmm....

I would recommend pretty much every slice I have tasted!  The chicken and pesto is gooood, the mushroom and feta is good, wow they are all really tasty and have the perfect amounts of tomato/cheese on them....urgh I'm drooling, I want one now....
author: Melanie B.

description:
To be honest, from all the pizza I've eaten around the country, Bellissimo should be more of a 3 star rating.  Considering the cardboard pizza around the majority of San Francisco however, Bellissimo is pretty decent.

Have completely fallen for their Pesto, Spinach, Feta pizza, it's really pretty damn good.  You just have to make sure to never show up early.  If they say it will be ready in 15 minutes, pick it up in 20-25.  I've made the mistake of showing up a few minutes early once or twice and they rush to pull it out o the oven and the result is pretty nasty.

Good pizza, quickly made, and the Italian guys behind the counter are usually full of enthusiasm, the one guy I normally order from is always so proud of his pizza he always opens the box and flashes me a huge grin as we both marvel at the fresh pie.
author: Tyler D.

description: Probably one of the better pizza delivery restaurants. Pizza is solid with generous toppings and great crust ratio. They are great on the phone (very polite and not yelling at you), very courteous and deliver quickly. Take advantage of the Yelp coupon for 10% off.
author: Ed L.

description: Pizza was mediocre at best and the wings were literally inedible. Wet and mushy, they made me want to hurl. Also it was expensive! 0 stars, definitely avoid
author: Jason A.

description: I ordered the combo. It came luke warm. I'd say that it's only one notch above Digiorno.  I'm getting pizza only from Costco from now on.
author: Mike N.

description: Just got a medium Bellissimo Special, we'll see how the pizza is here. I actually just also saw a special in the window, same thing I ordered but cheaper, larger pizza with a 2 liter free soda. The guy didn't even offer us the deal when we ordered... went up to the counter & asked if they offered any specials, he acted  So far the staff have been friendly, the place is fairly clean as well.
author: Z Z.

description:
Best pizza I ever had in San Fransisco and I've been to plenty to compare. The cashier guy was very friendly to me and my girlfriend and greeting us with a smile and friendliness. He brought the pizza to our table hot and fresh. I had to wait for it to cool a little but when I eat it I loved it. 

I had pepperoni while my girlfriend had the chicken with the white sauce, don't know what its called but she loved it. I tried hers too and it was good. Both pizzas had great flavor and no nasty after taste like I experienced at other places where they just make something cheap and quick to lodge in your stomach to cure the hurt of a empty belly. 

The place has the small but clean street food type of shop feel to it. Right next door is a great gellato ice cream place for dessert. Would go back anytime especially knowing there is such thing as good pizza in San Fransisco.
author: Manny R.

description:
I said before this place was mediocre, and I still agree with myself.  Hah.

BUT... They're open later than anything around, even on weeknights.  And that's worth another star, right?
author: Rocco B.

description: A good slice for $2.75 and all the ambiance of a NY pizza joint.
author: Bob T.

description: Awful, awful pizza. It looked and tasted like one of those Tombstone pizzas you buy at the supermarket and heat up at home. Those are probably better actually.
author: Ian N.

description: For a college dormy pizza it's not half bad. I seldom eat pizza so when i do i want to make sure the calories spent, the shame, the guilt, the inevitable breakouts in weeks to come- is worth it all. The cutest nicest little latino guy ever runs this place but he doesn't speak much english. The crust is chewy because it's supposed to be- not because it's over inflated with air, stale, or too thick. The tomatoe sauce has really great flavour but the cheese itself doesn't really. It's dark golden brown on the bottom which is really nice. The crust is really the best standard crust i have probably ever had. Nothing super stands out about this pizza, but it's a perfect standard and their sizes are larger than other places. Piraats down two blocks isn't as good as this place and Bellissimo is ALOT less oily and less expensive. The place is quaint, i imagine they are open so late because of all the college kids. He didn't understand me when i told him he could keep the change so i placed it in the tip jar, smiled and walked off
author: Brittainie B.

description: Another added cheese, cheese slices.  This one set me back $2.75.  Average thickness, taste, enthusiasm...
author: Jeff J.

description:
This place is great.  There, I said it.  And the people who work there are friendly and remember you, which I love.  I remember when this place was Ramino's and the scary Greek guy worked there, and when I say scary it's not "molester" scary, it's "mofioso" scary.  So yes, this place has much improved since those days.
   
   In all seriousness, they make a fine pizza and are open til 2-2:30 a.m. which is great for all the drunks in the area fighting for the last slice of their tasty pesto chicken.  The inside is painted in bright colors so you don't feel like you're in a dungeon (kinda like Ramino's used to be), there's a flat-screen TV usually playing some soccer (or football), and it's clean.  There's enough seating for, say...max.15 folks but there are some tables outside as well.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I love this place!  The guys who work there are super friendly, the service is quick, and the pizza has something in the crust akin to crack-cocaine that kept me coming back over and over again.

I hate Spinach, and don't generally enjoy feta, but their spinach-feta pizza quickly became one of my favorites.  The toppings in general are high-quality, and they always have soccer on the tube.

Excellent.
author: Jess T.

description: We ordered pizza for pick up one night while in town.  Very tasty pizza.  Better than others on the street.   Would recommend eating from here.
author: Daniette H.

description:
The pizza's good.  I was a reticent to try this non-descript place 'cause I already have my fave pizza places, but since it's just a skip away from my apartment, I had to try it.  

The crust is tasty and has a thin layer of cornmeal on the bottom.  The sauce is good, and the toppings as well--  all in all a very solid pie.

The guys who work there are really nice!  It's a nice, new addition to my 'hood.
author: Karen W.

description:
This eatery is a very 'hole in the wall' location. I ducked in here to have a quick slice because I was hungry. Inside, the pizzas offered were pepperoni, cheese and a slice of chicken with pesto.  
$4..00 later I was served the pesto chicken. The pizza I had many layers of flavor in the sauce. It turned out better than I expected. 
Its a pretty big menu with the usuals (garlic bread and salad) , and offers free delivery. 
Its a little tricky parking here, so watch yourself.
Check this place out if you are in this area.
author: madass d.

description:
3.5 actually.

This place is much better than the place that was here before (Eric W is right - it was the worst pizza in the city)!  

This isn't the best pizza in the city but it's not bad.  I was a little drunk and starving when I went in and don't remember exactly what type of pizza I had - pepperoni and something else.   It is practically across the street from my house so it is  the perfect place late night stop after drinking.  I suspect I'll be back.
author: Julie P.

description: Came here for some late night pizza, and was disappointed.  They get brownie points for being open late, but I was hoping for much more.  I ordered one with anchovies, and got the first slice of a freshly made pie.  Crust wasn't as thin or crispy as I like, and the sauce was bland.  It's comparable to Cybelle's on Bush and Jones.  Victor's on Polk and Pine is much better.
author: Carlin E.

description:
The pizza place for vain people! The reason why I say that is because of the huge mirror on the side counter. I was checking myself out while I ate. It was interesting. I didn't know I had a "pizza face" until I ate at  this place. The pizza was just ok. It was close to my friends place and I was craving pizza after a nice 1.3 mile walk. Don't expect to be wow'ed with this place. I had the Bellissimo supreme. I thought it was ok. Kinda reminded me of Costco slices. I think it was sitting out for a while because it lacked that fresh slice flavor to it. Staff was nice and friendly. Everyone was all smiles. Kinda scary if you ask me. 
If you're hungry, lazy and in the area give this place a shot.
author: Eduardo M.

description: Got a slice for lunch it was just OK,  nothing to write home about ..
author: Attaicus C.

description: They have the potential to make great pizza. Our friends enjoyed the hawaiian pizza but the pizza we ordered was not good. it was undercooked. They put way to much large chunks of garlic which was also undercooked and very potent, not to mention the garlic was placed in large groups which made it so unbearable to eat. Also I payed for extra cheese, it seems I paid for hardly any cheese. The cheese was so thin on this pizza you can see the sauce. It seems like some cheep cosco cheese. We had to remove the garlic before baking the pizza again to get it to be done. The Hawaiian pizza i guess was great but that was coming from my eastern european friends who rarely eat pizza. I ordered a bottle of soda thinking it was a big bottle, ended up being a small bottle, and to add to that, it was warm! I couldn't believe they'd send out a warm bottle of soda. I am a picky eater. I have had great pizza before and this pizza comes no where close to it.I can't believe I am giving this place 2 stars. I doubt I will order from them again even if they offered it for free, but if I do and I end up getting a good pizza I will change my review.
author: Matthew F.

description: Tasty. The best New York-style pizza I've had in San Francisco so far. Not sure it's anything I'd write home about, and it certainly doesn't compare to what I used to eat when I lived in Manhattan, but if I'm in need of a quick slice of pizza in the Union Square area, this is where I'll go.
author: James B.

description: So if you need late night eats and are craving pizza for delivery Bellissimo is your spot.  You can avoid the national chains and they have some really good pies.  Well Theron L. was gracious enough to order for everyone at the Festizio afterparty after Keane L and his crew got done rocking Slims.  All three pies were quickly devoured and not just b/c it was a late night party but b/c they were tasty too.  The crusts were nicely crisp and the toppings were generous.  Overall a solid pizza spot - can't believe I never had them before!  Kicks the ass of mr Pizza Man, etc. etc.
author: Gene X.

description: Lots of options for late night pizza by the slice. Went here because of yelp, and my hotel is just across the street. Sure enough, the pizza was good enough to kill a late night desire for pizza. The pizza is a solid 2 leaning towards a 3. Dough is not hand tossed and the pizza was a little light on the sauce. Again, good enough.
author: David G.

description: Yet another quick pizza place in the Tenderloin, I'd have to say the pizza overall pretty good.  It's less greasy but the cheese tasted a little off to me.  In any case, compared to your other options in that neighborhood after 10 PM, it will probably taste like heaven.  Enjoy.
author: John H.

description: I have been going to place for years...tonight I make an order...delivery guys never comes....I call back and the owner yells at me calling me a Bitch saying he rang my doorbell....turn to find out he went to wrong address and would not apologize for the vulgar Language...and then refused to return me my money...I will never step foot in their restaurant...what type of owner calls customers Bitches...Seriously...I'm still in shock they have always been so nice...and I still never got my damn Order...
author: Daniella G.

description: After 11 p.m., other than bars, there's nothing much open in the area, so, a well-made slice doesn't go unappreciated.  Stars are for the food and service.  Store itself isn't anything special.  Bleary-eyed late night customers generally take their food to go.
author: Poet D.

description: OK- 3 stars now- the California special is chicken, pesto, feta cheese, and some other chunky madness. Chunks rock. Chicken on pizza is always questionable- but these guys have now been open since 6/16/08 and they are eager to please with shit-eating grins, almost obnoxious amounts of "thank yous" and well, hells bells, they're trying at least. If they can get a real cool menu that's not hand-written, and maybe a few more varieties of pizzas on the menu, they may go to a 4!!
author: Braden B.

description: My wife and I were tired of walking and decided to stay in for Valentines and ordered from Bellissimo to take back to our hotel.  Really good pie.
author: Lucas J.

description: Great pizza, fast service, super friendly people working there! I always order pizza from there.
author: Stephanie S.

description: good pizza but they have great paninis I wish they were less expensive especially that they made their own bread
author: Leo T.

description: good late night eats or a quick bite.  $3 for a slice of pepperoni or $4 for a combo. The crust isn't too thick which is my preference. A definite neighborhood staple.
author: Phong D.

description: Not a bad place to go after a night of drinking.  Even though the sign says 2 AM, they typically open until 2:15 or 2:30.  The owners are friendly, and pizzas are decent -- not out of the world, but definitely tasty enough.  Prices range from $2-4 based on what your order.
author: Bill T.

description:
probably best by the slice joint in the area (not saying much, but total comfort food). open till 2 am so i go here after i drink a lot.

my favorite is the cheese - they're baking a new one as soon as another comes out of the oven and it's always half something and half something else. I love the hawaiian. they use fresh pineapples and it's seriously amazing. Their pepperoni pizza is really good - perfect balance of sauce and crispy meat. I love the classic cheese, classic pesto, and also the california special -chicken, pesto, feta and spinach over tomato sauce and mozarella. Just make sure you request fresh slices and you only have to wait like 5 minutes. even the reheated slices are so good - crisp crust, soft in the middle, and gooey on top and perfectly doughy.

Personally I prefer sweeter tomato sauce, less dough and less cheese - my perfect pizza is a thin-cursted margherita, but at  $2.75-$3.50 a slice - and discounts on multiple slices, this joint can't be beat in the pizza-challenged Bay-area. Also, they DELIVER!
author: Y K.

description: For living just around the corner I don't come here enough. I usually get their chicken pesto pizza slice and it always hits the spot. What I like most of this place, are the people who work here - they are truly the nicest and most easy going people ever.
author: K. E.

description: I live right across the street from here, and have been here more times than I'd like to admit. I've gone at all hours, all days of the week, and the pizza is easily the best Friday/Saturday. Most likely because they're jam packed and the pizza is all fresh. During the week it can be a bit underwhelming, but be sure to check it out on the weekend.
author: Alycia M.

description: The guys that run this place are great.  They're very nice, and they'll do custom sandwiches that are out of this world.  Bellissimo's pesto sauce is something to cherish, and their regular slices are pretty decent, too.  Combine all this with the fact that they're open until 2:30 most evenings, and they easily garner five stars.
author: Robert P.

description: Ate there during our stay at the Hotel Vertigo. They are open late so it's perfect after a night of drinking. The pizza is delicious and the slices are really large :)
author: Celia P.

description: Perfect amount of crust, sauce, cheese and toppings. They are also really friendly.  Almost gave them 5, but it could have been hotter (temp) and the sausage could have been more spicy.  All in all a great slice.
author: Jane P.

description:
This is a good solid pizza place and the owners are nice.  It's my go-to late night spot and I will order delivery or carry out from here if I'm ordering pizza.   

Their crust is of the thick fluffy variety, and their special "bellissimo" pizza is deeelicious!
author: brooke m.

description: omg.  I called and told them I was a new local  and ask them what veggie pizza they had.  He read all the pizzas off to me, I told them I would pick it up and also ordered a meat pizza for my husband.  It was hot good and the friendlist staff I have ever meet.  Tottaly go there!
author: jud a.

description:
I've only ate here once but I'm there all the time since my friend loves this place. I had the pepperoni pizza, nothing that special but not horrible either. The pizza and a can of soda came out to $4 even, not bad after a night of bar/club hoppin around the area. 

Oh and they just recently got rid of the cardboard and magic marker menu and stepped it up to something official and legit lol. 

They close at 2am, atleast on friday nights when we're always there.
author: Mafia J.

description: ok so the guy that worked there was a total dick.  He was giving me the stink eye.  I asked for a slice of pizza and he gave me a dirty look, and said we dont have that.  I was disappointed by the service.  So i left and waited outside while my friend ordered his pizza, which was cold and dry.... avoid this place.
author: Neems y.

description:
I've shared a building with the pizza place for years. They have new owners that took over the place with in the last year.... I'm so glad. They are supper clean and friendly! I think I eat there at least once a week! 

They are friendly,  great service and good consistent pizza :) 

I love that if it's not ready, they'll make it fresh and or recommend good mixes of toppings. :)
author: alexcia d.

description: Great late night drunk food! Felt it the next morning though... haha Had the pesto, and the special, which was the works. Very friendly service though. Open late til 3 AM! How convenient!
author: Jameson B.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza places!  They are not as good as Amiccis but not nearly as expensive either.  The owner is also very friendly and remembers your name after you go there a couple of times.
author: Michael F.

description: Yumm! I love this place. My boyfriend and I discovered it a few weeks ago when everywhere else was closed. the pizza is tastey. the price is very reasonable and the delivery is super fast. The staff is friendly and it's open later than everyone else... even on sundays!
author: Rhonda Y.

description: I love this place, the pizza is similar to Blondie's and it's staffed by friendly neighborhood folks. Can't go wrong with pepperoni and pineapple.
author: Ed M.

description: Classic New York style pizza.  The best in the city!
author: Mitch S.
